title: Drawing, "Design for Ornament:  Ireland and its Religion [Irlande et sa Religion]", 1765
medium: Pen and brush and black ink, wash, black chalk on white laid paper, pen and black ink framing lines
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower center: Irlande et sa Religion; upper right: 85
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: In the form of a portal, two caryatids support a pediment, with swags encasing a central medallion.  Lower right, a drawing of religious attributes leans against the door.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Ornament:  Ireland and its Religion [Irlande et sa Religion]", 1765.
1765. Pen and brush and black ink, wash, black chalk on white laid paper, pen and black ink framing lines. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-67.
